IRM 21.7.9, dated August 23, 2021 (effective October 1, 2021), is superseded. The following IRM Procedural Updates (IPU), have been incorporated into this IRM: 21U1223 issued 11-02-2021, IPU 22U0228 issued 02-04- 2022, IPU 22U0314 issued 03-01-2022, IPU 22U0451 issued 04-01-2022 and IPU 22U0585 issued 05-04-2022.
This IRM is intended for Customer Account Services employees working Business Master File Duplicate Filing Conditions.
Table of Contents
) This section contains information on Business Master File (BMF) accounts involving duplicate ﬁling conditions. File (

) Purpose: The procedures in this IRM are a translation of a variety of legal Filing administrative authorities into practical guidance for the Customer Service resentatives and Tax Examining Assistants who are assigned BMF duplicate ﬁling condition inventory. (
) Audience: The primary users of this IRM are Customer Service tives (CSR) and Tax Examining Assistants who are assigned BMF duplicate ﬁling condition inventory. (
) Policy Owner: The policy owner is the Director, Accounts Management, and Investment Division. (
) Program Owner: The program owner is Wage and Investment, Accounts agement, Policy and Procedures BMF (PPB). (
) Primary Stakeholders: The primary stakeholders are Wage and Investment (W&I), Small Business/Self Employed (SBSE), and Large Business and national (LB&I). (

) Program Goals: The BMF sites strive to maintain integrity, quality, and lence in the service provided taxpayers by making every effort to achieve a high customer accuracy and efficiency rate. The duplicate ﬁling condition program goals are included with other BMF tax type inventory production published in the annual Accounts Management Program Letter. (
) Accounts Management (AM) employees respond to taxpayer inquires and paper) as well as claims, certain applications, internal requests, and scripts. (

) Accounts Management Policy and Procedures BMF (PPB) has for this IRM content which issues guidance to employees who assist with resolving account issues and processing amended returns. These dures include Internal Data Retrieval System (IDRS) input instructions. IRM is published on an annual basis. (
) Site management officials provide daily program support through quality review, training, timely communication of procedural changes within the program, and elevation of guidance gaps. (
) Employees working the program are responsible for following IRM completing assigned training, reviewing updates during read time, and reporting guidance gaps to management. (

) Program management and review is essential for achieving the program identiﬁed in the Accounts Management Program Letter. The program ness is determined by employees successfully using IRM guidance to necessary account actions and duties. The duplicate ﬁling condition is combined with other BMF inventory streams and randomly selected for review. Centralized Evaluative Review (CER) and site mangers set the allocation, so the employee receives a balance of phone and paper relative to an employee’s work assignments. (

) The program monitoring and work reviews are performed for the following reasons: • To make an objective assessment of an employee’s performance on ongoing basis and to ensure that adequate information is available mid-year and annual appraisals • To protect the rights of customers • To identify error trends and training needs (
) Centralized Evaluative Review (CER) conduct quality telephone reviews through Verint and correspondence reviews through the Correspondence Imaging System (CIS). (
) Site managers conduct the following types of reviews: • Inventory Management using the CCA
, IDRS Automated Age Listing (AAL) and CCA

, IDRS Multiple Case Control Listing. listings are available on the Control-D/Web Access server, which login program control. • IDRS Security Reviews • Performance reviews on effective case and call resolution according IRM guidelines. • Side-by-side non-evaluative reviews for skill development. • Reviews of closed cases for both accuracy and productivity to determine if work is being closed in an efficient and effective • Workload reviews to assess whether the amount of time being commensurate with the complexity and type of work. suspended. (

) The duplicate ﬁling condition inventory is combined with other BMF inventory streams and subject to Accounts Management enterprise controls. This program is included with all BMF management reviews and operational reviews. (

) Accounts Management uses the Embedded Quality Review Program to closed case work. The Quality Review process provides a method to measure, and improve the quality of work. Quality Review data is used to provide quality statistics for the IRS’s Business Results portion of the Measures, and/or to identify trends, problem areas, training needs, and tunities for improvement. (
) Centralized Quality Review System (CQRS) is operated by the Joint Opera- tions Center (JOC) to provide independent quality review services for lines. (

) Local reviews are performed to focus attention on areas that require ment. The local quality reviews are performed by staffs reporting to the Assurance Manager, Corrective and Preventative Action System Manager (CPAS), or other units that have quality assurance duties. Local quality are also used for employee development and on-the-job instruction. (

) Quality Review data is used by management to provide a basis for and improving program effectiveness by identifying: • Defect(s) resulting from site or systemic action(s) or inaction(s), • Driver(s) of customer accuracy, • Reason(s) for defect occurrence, • Defect trends, • Recommendation(s) for corrective action, and • Training needs.
